definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: His voice still stood with courage.
sentences.chinese: 他的語音依然是那麼勇敢堅定。

sentences.english: Professor Jardine is a committed socialist.
sentences.chinese: 賈丁教授是堅定的社會主義者。

sentences.english: She had a cultivated mind, and was, generally speaking, rational and consistent;
sentences.chinese: 她心性嫺雅，一般說來也很明智，堅定。

sentences.english: You have to stand strong in salons these days.
sentences.chinese: 現在在美髮店裏你得堅定立場。

sentences.english: Zhang Xiaoxiao also strengthened the conviction stick.
sentences.chinese: 也堅定了張筱筱堅持下去的信念。

sentences.english: I imagine my father’s expression remained stoic through it all.
sentences.chinese: 我回想父親在當時遊戲中的表情一直很堅定。

sentences.english: I firmly believe in collective leadership .
sentences.chinese: 我堅定地相信集體領導。

sentences.english: Doing good deeds requires self-confidence, to dispel all doubts and fear.
sentences.chinese: 爲善要有自信，才能發揮不畏懼的堅定力量。

sentences.english: Reiterating that the Australian government will firmly pursue the one-China policy, Howard said he fully agrees to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亞政府堅定奉行一箇中國政策。

sentences.english: Confidence is the source of strength.
sentences.chinese: 堅定信心是戰勝危機的力量源泉。

sentences.english: We can keep out, if we have the resolute national will to do so.
sentences.chinese: 美國可以置身戰爭之外，只要全國人民意志堅定。

sentences.english: Only by sticking to the socialist road can we do away with the root cause of poverty. (p. 330)
sentences.chinese: 只有堅定走社會主義門路才華挖失落窮根。

sentences.english: China will unswervingly carry out its independent foreign policy of peace in a comprehensive manner.
sentences.chinese: 中國將堅定不移地綜合執行和平獨立的外交政策。

sentences.english: Kazakhstan firmly supports the one-China policy and the Chinese Anti-Secession Law.
sentences.chinese: 哈方堅定支持一箇中國政策和中國《反分裂國家法》。

sentences.english: His sharp, quizzical eyes look back, unblinking and unyielding.
sentences.chinese: 他的敏銳的，疑惑的眼睛看着後面，堅定而不屈。

sentences.english: If you're sure-footed, they want to follow in your footsteps.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的步伐堅定，人們就會跟從你。

definition: determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
